$interpreted: Puggi: Wakey, wakey Pang! My fun sensors are tingling again! It's coming from that side. Let's go and check it out together.

Pang: ... You're so noisy... It's still early...
L, let me sleep... just a little longer...

Puggi: Hmph, if you're not coming then I'll go by myself.
Don't come crying when you realize how much fun you missed!

Puggi: What the...? You're blocking my way, you moron.
Don't you dare get between Puggi and his fun!
Stewart: I didn't expect to meet you here?
Stewart: Boys, get him!

Bodyguard: Finally... we finally got him.
*Cries*... This has been a long journey...
Stewart: Stop crying. We're still on the run from a horde of creditors. We better sell him to the lizard nobles ASAP to get the cash needed for our escape.

Bodyguard: B, boss...
One of the creditors is right in front of us...
Sherlock: Oh, hello~ what a coincidence. I didn't expect to run into you in a place like this.
Sherlock: Since we're all here... about the 10,000 Curren you borrowed from me last time, isn't it time to pay me back?
Stewart: M, Mister Sherlock, could you just give me a few more days...
Sherlock: Another delay request? Do you really want me to strip down your house for assets?

Stewart: That... I... Umm...
Ah, right! I'll pay my debts with this fat bird.

Sherlock: Hmm? Those croissant horns... chubby figure...
These features seem to match the creature in the Desert Kingdom legends;
Sherlock: the one that lizard nobles used to eat as a tasty delicacy.
Stewart: As expected from Mister Sherlock, you know your goods. I was preparing to sell him to the lizard nobles.
Stewart: They are paying me 20,000 Curren. I'll sell him to Mister at a bargain price of 15,000 Curren. You can even make a little profit if you resell to him...
Puggi: Load of BS. Look at me; handsome, charming, cool, and tasty! I say I'm worth at least 10K!
Sherlock: That expensive!?
Puggi: At minimum a friendly price of 9.9K, no cheaper than that!
Stewart: ... Shut up. Stop interrupting my business!
Puggi: And quietly watch you insult me by slashing my price like that? No bleepin way!

Stewart: Don't be full of yourself, you fat bird!
The lizard nobles were only willing to pay 8000 for your sorry *** last time!
Sherlock: What? So you were trying to scam me back there?
Stewart: Crap... Then how about I just give you this bird to pay off my debts? You don't have to pay me anything else.
Sherlock: That won't be enough. You still have to pay the interest!
Stewart: There's interest as well? You can't do that!
Sherlock: Oh, so you don't have the money? Then prepare to take a beating!
Puggi: I'll help you out. This dumb baldy must learn his lesson the hard way!
Puggi: Haha, look at him run away like a little wimp. That's the price you pay for offending the almighty Puggi!
Puggi: Pal, you're a pretty good~ I will accept you as my minion. Let's see, you can be...
Puggi: Umm... Why are you looking at me with such weird eyes?
Sherlock: Hmm~ How much should I sell you to the lizard nobles for...
Puggi: H, hold your horses; it would be such a waste if you just sell me like that.
Puggi: Look at me, I'm adorable and likable. If you gift me to a girl, I can promise that they'll be very happy.

Sherlock: Is that so? Speaking of which, 
my daughter does indeed like round fluffy dolls a lot...
Puggi: Daughter? Right, you can make money anytime, but you can't buy happiness. It will certainly be the right choice if you gift me to your daughter.
Sherlock: Hmm... good point. Then a decision has been made. You will be a present for Lisa. Follow me.
